definition: to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
to carry out official duties and observe the law

sentences.english: Keeping the law is a legal obligation and moral requirement which manifests as the law-abiding action.
sentences.chinese: 守法是一种法定的义务和道德要求。

sentences.english: Everybody must observe the law not excepting the president.
sentences.chinese: 人人须守法，总统亦无例外。

sentences.english: Good interpersonal skills, disciplined, attention to details, well organized.
sentences.chinese: 良好的沟通能力，遵纪守法，注重细节，有条不紊。

sentences.english: Foreign companies in China should bear in mind that business is business and they should operate according to law.
sentences.chinese: 我们要求在华经营的外国企业在商言商，守法经营。

sentences.english: I'll be a citizen who obeys the laws from now on.
sentences.chinese: 我从现在起将做一个守法公民。

sentences.english: The righteous is not innocent of the deeds of the wicked
sentences.chinese: 行善守法者在恶人恶行中并非纯洁无邪。

sentences.english: You shall be of good behaviour and keep the peace.
sentences.chinese: 你必须行为良好，奉公守法。

sentences.english: Empower law-abiding gun owners to defend themselves.
sentences.chinese: 允许那些守法的枪支拥有者用枪来自卫。

sentences.english: The only way we can work is under the law.
sentences.chinese: 遵章守法是唯一可行的道路。

sentences.english: It assumes that the otherwise law-abiding citizen had a good reason for standing their ground.
sentences.chinese: 新法律认为守法公民有理由坚持他们的立场。

sentences.english: For common law observant, instructing them.
sentences.chinese: 对一般守法者的教育功能等。

sentences.english: The civilized political activity should be the behavior that keeping the law and respecting the morality.
sentences.chinese: 文明的政治行为应当是守法敬德的行为。

sentences.english: They kept Service Management Group clean.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直使服务管理公司奉公守法。

sentences.english: A law-abiding person needs to keep his nose clean.
sentences.chinese: 奉公守法的人应该避免制造麻烦。

sentences.english: No one who ignores the law can call themselves a good citizen.
sentences.chinese: 不守法的人称不上好公民。

definition: to carry out official duties and observe the law
to behave oneself/to abide by the rules
to show consideration for (others)/to yield to (another vehicle etc)/courtesy/comity
to know the law and break it (idiom); consciously going against the rules
to challenge the law (idiom)/to knowingly violate the law
to promote knowledge of laws/rights awareness
to break the rules/to break discipline
